meanings.definition: In a manner that is equal or equivalent in status or importance
meanings.sent1: The two friends worked coequally on the project, sharing the tasks equally.
meanings.sent2: The siblings were raised coequally by their parents, receiving the same love and attention.
meanings.sent3: The students were coequally excited about the upcoming field trip, jumping with joy.
meanings.sent4: The stars shone coequally in the night sky, each one twinkling brightly.
meanings.sent5: The colors of the rainbow blended coequally, creating a beautiful arc in the sky.

meanings.definition: In a way that is evenly or fairly distributed or shared
meanings.sent1: The cookies were coequally divided among the children, ensuring each got a fair share.
meanings.sent2: The resources were coequally allocated to all departments, preventing any shortages.
meanings.sent3: The team members coequally contributed to the success of the project, each playing a vital role.
meanings.sent4: The sunlight filtered coequally through the leaves, casting a dappled pattern on the ground.
meanings.sent5: The laughter echoed coequally in the room, filling it with joy and warmth.
